definition: to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: I acknowledged his politeness with a bow.
The intrepid General Delort made the military salute to the English battery.
sentences.chinese: 无畏将军德洛尔立即向英国炮队还礼。

sentences.english: Being overly eager to return favor is in fact an act of ungratefulness.
sentences.chinese: 过分地急于还礼，其实是一种忘恩的行为。

sentences.english: Don't feel the need to  reciprocate if your boss gives you something.
sentences.chinese: 要是老板送了你什么东西，不要觉得一定要还礼。

definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to salute/to greet
to salute/to make one's salutations
to return a courtesy/return gift
to bow
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to bow with hands held in front
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
old-fashioned women's obeisance/Taiwan pr. [lian4 ren4]
to greet by raising clasped hands
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
deferential/respectful
to express thanks
